I decided on Wave because of the feature to take pictures. Firstly, I love this app 90% of the time. But every so often it glitches out badly and I lose huge chunks of recording time. Wow. I was sceptical, especially after my first recording. But as soon as I hit "transcribe" it blew my mind. My rambling notes turned into a bullet pointed thing of beauty. content: one of the best handwriting app

Some small missing features like rotating a selection, otherwise amazing for drawing or taking notes on a huge canvas. Supports Samsung S-pen button for using eraser quickly (though sadly the 'precise' mode of the eraser doesn't draw an exact erased line, it's a bit odd to use).

bought the lifetime subscription for 800 INR (around $9) and it's almost completely worth it. The app has it's fair share of glitches whenever you write a lot on a board or add too many notes to a folder, and the sync does freeze sometimes but no major errors. It's extremely easy to use but it could use some additional features which would make it PERFECT- 1. Change of the thickness adjustment to a number-based system like samsung notes. 2. Add the ability to crop images added to boards/notes
replyContent:
Hi,
You can now enjoy the new image crop feature for pictures added to your notes. Simply update to the latest version to start using it.

Best regards,
Sebastian ‚Äì MyScript Support Team
